hackathon-description-text: RevolutionUC is a student hackathon in which we invite students from across the midwest to partake in a weekend of code, community, and self-improvement. You don't have to attend the University of Cincinnati and you don't have to be a computer science major or engineering student. We're looking for people who share our passion to do awesome things with technology.
hackathon-eligibility: RevolutionUC is open to everyone currently enrolled in an accredited college (or similar program) and high school students.
hackathon-rules:
Please reference the 
 for rules for RevolutionUC.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: MLH is providing Dell Tablets and first place medals.
2nd Place will receive a bluetooth audio speaker and 2nd place medals.
3rd Place will receive Particle's Photon kits and 3rd place medals.
Lisnr has provided Rasperry Pi 2 Starter Kits to be given to the team that makes the best use of their API. Email
IBM Internet of Things Division is offering up Arduino Uno R3 Starter Kits.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Watson IoT Bluemix

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Whichever team has the best use of Amazon Web Services will be award 1TB hard drives.
The team that develops the best dev tool will be awarded octocat statues.
The team that makes the best use of hardware, such as Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, Oculus Rifts, etc, will win Arduino Starter Kits.
The team that delivers the best mobile hack will be awarded with quadcopters.
The team that develops the best college themed app will receive University of Cincinnati themed drinkware.
